description: Borrowed from New Latin aphēmia, from Ancient Greek ἀ- (a-, “not”) + φήμη (phḗmē, “voice”). By surface analysis, a- +‎ -phemia.

nouns.description: aphemia (countable and uncountable, plural aphemias) (speech pathology)

entries.meaning: A type of aphasia in which the ability to speak is lost or severely impaired.
